abstract: Century Assn has elected Susan Morrison as its president, first time New York City's famed private club of arts and letters has elected woman to position in its 169 years; election has not been reported, and lack of attention milestone has received reflects club's complicated history with gender issues.
lead_paragraph: Susan Morrison, the articles editor at The New Yorker, is the first woman to lead the Century Association, New York City’s pre-eminent private club of arts and letters, in its 169-year history.

headline.main: Election of a Female President Opens a New Era for a Former Boys Club
headline.print_headline: Election of Female President Quietly Opens a New Era at a Former Boys Club

snippet: Susan Morrison, the articles editor at The New Yorker, is the first woman to lead the Century Association, New York City’s pre-eminent private club of arts and letters, in its 169-year history.
